trans-unit.source: Represents the style of a menu item in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu"></xref> control.
This class cannot be inherited.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle> class to represent the style of a menu item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control.
A menu item is displayed in either a static menu or a dynamic menu.

A static menu is always displayed in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control, whereas a dynamic menu is displayed only when the user positions the mouse pointer over a parent menu item that contains a dynamic submenu.
You can specify different style characteristics (such as font size and color) for each of the different menu item types.
The following table lists the available menu item styles.
Menu item style property
Description
The style settings for a dynamic menu item when the mouse pointer is positioned over it.
The style settings for an individual dynamic menu item.
The style settings for a dynamic menu.
The style settings for the currently selected dynamic menu item.
The style settings for a static menu item when the mouse pointer is positioned over it.
The style settings for an individual static menu item.
The style settings for a static menu.
The style settings for the currently selected static menu item.
When multiple style properties are set for a static menu item, the style properties are applied in the following order:
<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.StaticMenuStyle%2A>.
<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.StaticMenuItemStyle%2A>.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.LevelMenuItemStyles%2A> collection or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.LevelSubMenuStyles%2A> collection is defined, it is applied at this time, overriding the other menu item style properties.
<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.StaticSelectedStyle%2A>.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.LevelSelectedStyles%2A> collection is defined, it is applied at this time, overriding the other menu item style properties.
<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.StaticHoverStyle%2A>.
Likewise, the style properties for a dynamic menu item are applied in the following order:
<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.DynamicMenuStyle%2A>.
<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.DynamicMenuItemStyle%2A>.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.LevelMenuItemStyles%2A> collection or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.LevelSubMenuStyles%2A> collection is defined, it is applied at this time, overriding the other menu item style properties.
<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.DynamicSelectedStyle%2A>.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.LevelSelectedStyles%2A> collection is defined, it is applied at this time, overriding the other menu item style properties.
<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.DynamicHoverStyle%2A>.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle> class inherits most of its members from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> class.
It extends the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> class by providing properties that control the amount of space around a menu item's text, as well as the space between adjacent menu items.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle.HorizontalPadding%2A> property to control the amount of space to the left and right of the menu item's text.
Similarly, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle.VerticalPadding%2A> property controls the amount of space above and below the menu item's text.

You can control the amount of spacing between the menu item that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle> object is applied to and its adjacent menu items by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle.ItemSpacing%2A> property.
For more information on the inherited style settings, see <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to create a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle> class.

This constructor is commonly used when extending the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> class to initialize the menu item style properties, such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.DynamicMenuItemStyle%2A>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle"></xref> class using the specified state information.
Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle> class using the <xref:System.Web.UI.StateBag> object specified by the bag parameter.
This member is used primarily by control developers when deriving a custom control from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> class.
It is used to initialize the menu item style properties, such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu.DynamicMenuItemStyle%2A>.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref> that represents the state bag in which menu item style information is stored.

Copies the style properties of the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> object into the current instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle"></xref> class.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle.CopyFrom%2A> method to duplicate the style properties of the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle> object that calls this method.

All properties in the current instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle> class will be replaced by the corresponding properties in the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object.
To copy style properties without replacing any set values, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle.MergeWith%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> to copy.
Gets or sets the amount of space to the left and right of the menu item's text.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle.HorizontalPadding%2A> property to control the amount of horizontal space around the text of the menu item to which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle> object is applied.
This space is inserted between the left edge of the text and the border of the text area, and between the right edge of the text and the text's border.
To control the vertical spacing, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle.VerticalPadding%2A> property.
The amount of space (in pixels) to the left and right of the menu item's text.
The default is 0.
The selected value is of type <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.UnitType.Percentage"></xref>.
\- or -
The selected value is less than `0`.
Gets or sets the amount of vertical spacing between the menu item to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle"></xref> object is applied and its adjacent menu items.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle.ItemSpacing%2A> property to control the amount of vertical spacing between a menu item to which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle> object is applied and its adjacent menu items at the same level.

This space is inserted between the upper edge of the current menu item and the lower edge of the previous menu item, as well as between the lower edge of the current menu item and upper edge of the next menu item.
The upper space is not rendered for the first menu item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Menu> control.
The amount of vertical spacing (in pixels) between the menu item to which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle"></xref> object is applied and its adjacent menu items.
The default is 0.

Combines the style properties of the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> object with those of the current instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle"></xref> class.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle.MergeWith%2A> method to combine the style properties of the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object with the style properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle> object that this method is called from.

This method joins the style properties by setting each property that is not set in the current <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle> object with its corresponding value in the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object.
Only properties that have not been set will be updated.

If a property in the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object is not set, the corresponding property in the current <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle> object does not change.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> to combine settings with.
Returns the current instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle"></xref> class to its original state.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle.Reset%2A> method to remove any defined style elements from the state bag and reset the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle> object to its original state.
Gets or sets the amount of space above and below a menu item's text.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle.VerticalPadding%2A> property to control the amount of vertical space around the text of the menu item to which the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle> object is applied.
This space is inserted between the upper edge of the text and the border of the text area, as well as between the lower edge of the text and the text's border.
To control the horizontal spacing, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MenuItemStyle.HorizontalPadding%2A> property.
The amount of space (in pixels) above and below a menu item's text.
The default is 0.
The selected value is of type <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.UnitType.Percentage"></xref>.
\- or -
The selected value is less than `0`.
